ygData.subject: Re: Shadow Knights
ygData.msgSnippet: I try not to compare hybrids with non-hybrids. Comparing a Warrior with a Shadow Knight is unfair to say the least. However, another interesting fact that I
ygData.messageBody:
I try not to compare hybrids with non-hybrids. Comparing a Warrior with a Shadow Knight is unfair to say the least. However, another interesting fact that I found out was that the same spell casted by a lower level necromancer has a lesser probability of it being resisted than if it was casted by a SK.




-----Original Message-----
From: Michael Wooldirdge <mike@...>
To: eq_shadowknights@onelist.com <eq_shadowknights@onelist.com>
Date: Sunday, June 27, 1999 10:03 AM
Subject: Re: [eq_shadowknights] Shadow Knights


Shadow Knights are not unbalanced in any way I have a friend with a level 35 Shadow Knight and a level 28 warrior and his Shadow Knight is so much better then a warrior. Also you comparison of hp and the like is not fair because there are diffrent races and truth be told if you picked the best SK race ( Ogre ) and the best Paladin race ( Dwarf ) then you should easily have more hp then the paladin. Shadow Knights are a great class. Necromancers use Engulfing Darkness and Heaty Blood up until level 29 if they can figure out away to put there spells to good use then a Tank should easily be able to.
